column1: What is a microprocessor?
column2: A microprocessor is an integrated circuit having all the functionality of a central processing unit of a PC.
column3: A microprocessor is a computer processor where the data processing logic and control is included on a single integrated circuit, or a small number of integrated circuits
column4: The microprocessor contains the arithmetic, logic, and control circuitry required to perform the functions of a computer's central processing unit

column1: What is a Super class?
column2: A super class is the basis of all the classes. The object of the rest of the class has all the characteristics related to the superclass.
column3: The class from which the subclass is derived is called a superclass (also a base class or a parent class).
column5: a class from which other classes inherit code is called a superclass
column6: A superclass exists in a hierarchical relationship with its subclasses. When classes participate in inheritance relationships, they become "affiliated" with other classes.

column1: What is SDLC?
column2: SDLC stands for Software Development Life Cycle is a process that produces quality software products in less time. The stages involve by SDLC are: 1) planning, 2) design, 4) construction, 5) testing, and 6) deployment.
column3: SDLC is a framework defining tasks performed at each step in the software development process.
column4: SDLC is a process followed for a software project, within a software organization. It consists of a detailed plan describing how to develop, maintain, replace and alter or enhance specific software. The life cycle defines a methodology for improving the quality of software and the overall development process.

column1: what are its setps?
column2: Requirement analysis, In-depth planning, Product design, Coding, Testing, Deployment, Post-production maintenance.

column1: How do you identify bugs in a code?
column2: Use different software to find bugs in the source code.
column3: Check Your Syntax, Check debug messages in real time, Problem localization, Git bisect,

column1: What is an array?
column2: An array is a container that keeps a specific number of similar data types.

column1: What is artificial intelligence?
column2: Artificial Intelligence or machine intelligence is a common term that is used to build smart machines capable of performing tasks. The main aim of AI is to solve problems in a way that are better and faster.

column1: List out different principles of OOP
column2: The basic OOPS principle are: 1) encapsulation, 2) abstraction, 3) inheritance and 4) polymorphism.

column1: Can you name any three data structures?
column2: Trees , Stacks, Queues

column1: If you had to choose, what are your top two programming languages and what do you like about them?
column2:
My favorites might be Ruby and JavaScript. Ruby for how quickly it 
evolves and improves, which provides more learning opportunities, and 
JavaScript for how forgiving it is.

column1: How frequently do you find yourself coding on a daily and weekly basis?
column2:
I code daily for both work and my personal project. My last project for 
work was to build a website, and for personal use I’m currently 
designing a video game.

column1: What do you think is most important when it comes to double checking yours or a colleague’s programming work?
How do you avoid making mistakes in your code?
column2:
I use technology that helps me avoid errors, such as object-oriented 
programming languages. I also make sure my code can function effectively
 in different error situations by testing it before deployment with 
testing frameworks like Spring. I avoid repeating mistakes by using a 
log to document my coding errors and checking it frequently.
